Data.event_text: 3 January  Ukraine and Russia complete their first prisoner exchange in nearly five months, releasing over 200 people on each side, facilitated by mediation from the United Arab Emirates.

links.text: -"Ukraine and Russia in 'biggest prisoner swap' so far". 2024-01-03. Retrieved 2024-01-03.-

Data.event_text: 12 January  British prime minister Rishi Sunak visits Kyiv to reiterate his support for Ukraine.

links.text: -"PM in Kyiv: UK support will not falter". GOV.UK. Retrieved 2024-01-13.-

Data.event_text: 22 January  President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signs a decree recognizing some Russian territories, including parts of Bryansk Oblast and Krasnodar Krai, as historically inhabited by Ukrainians.

links.text: -"Zelensky signs decree recognizing some Russian territories as historically inhabited by Ukrainians". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-01-22. Retrieved 2024-01-22.-

Data.event_text: 24 January  Korochansky Il-76 crash A Russian Ilyushin IL-76 military transport plane carrying 65 Ukrainian prisoners of war, six crew members and three guards, crashes in Russia's Korochansky District, near the Ukrainian border, killing everybody on board.

links.text: -"Russia accuses Ukraine of downing plane with 65 POWs on board". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-01-24.-

Data.event_text: 30 January  Lviv Oblast becomes the first oblast to remove all Soviet-era monuments.

links.text: -"Governor: Lviv first oblast to complete decommunization process". Yahoo News. 2024-01-30. Retrieved 2024-01-31.-

Data.event_text: 31 January  Russia and Ukraine conduct a prisoner exchange on the border with 195 soldiers being returned to Russia, and 207 military personnel and civilians being returned to Ukraine, respectively. The deal is facilitated by the United Arab Emirates.

links.text: -"Ukraine and Russia complete first prisoner swap since plane crash". BBC News. 2024-01-31. Retrieved 2024-01-31.-

Data.event_text: 1 February  The European Union formally approves a €50 billion financial support package for Ukraine after Hungary withdraws its veto. The package is expected to help the Ukrainian government pay pensions, salaries and other costs over the next four years with the first funds being released in March.

links.text: -"Ukraine support package worth €50bn agreed by EU leaders". BBC News. 2024-02-01. Retrieved 2024-02-01.-

Data.event_text: 8 February  President Zelenskyy announces the dismissal of commander-in-chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces Valerii Zaluzhnyi, replacing him with Oleksandr Syrskyi.

links.text: -"Zelensky sacks Ukraine's commander-in-chief Valerii Zaluzhnyi". BBC. 2024-02-08. Retrieved 2024-02-08.-

-Butenko, Victoria; Tarasova-Markina, Daria; Carey, Andrew; Edwards, Christian (2024-02-08). "Zelensky fires Ukraine's military chief in major shakeup nearly two years into war". CNN. Retrieved 2024-02-08.-

Data.event_text: 7 March  Former military Chief of Staff Valerii Zaluzhnyi is appointed ambassador to the United Kingdom by President Zelenskyy.

links.text: -"Ukraine's Zelenskiy approves ex-army chief Zaluzhnyi's candidacy as envoy to UK". Reuters. March 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 March  20 Days in Mariupol, a documentary directed by filmmaker Mstyslav Chernov focusing on the siege of Mariupol during the Russian invasion of Ukraine, wins an Oscar for Best Documentary.

links.text: -"Ukraine war film 20 Days in Mariupol wins Oscar for best documentary". amp.theguardian.com. 11 March 2024. Retrieved 2024-03-11.-

Data.event_text: 13 March  The European Union agrees to provide a €5 billion boost to their Ukrainian military aid fund.

links.text: -"EU agrees 5 bln euro boost for Ukraine military aid fund". Reuters. March 13, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 March  Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant crisis Russian-installed officials at the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Enerhodar say that shelling hit critical infrastructure at the plant.

links.text: -"Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant reports shelling by Ukraine army". Reuters. March 15, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 April  Ukraine lowers the age of conscription from 27 years to 25.

links.text: -Sauer, Pjotr (2024-04-02). "Ukraine military draft age lowered to boost fighting force". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-04-04.-
-Sauer, Pjotr (2024-04-02). "Ukraine military draft age lowered to boost fighting force". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-04-04.-

Data.event_text: 11 April  Russian strikes destroy the Trypilska thermal power plant located in Kyiv Oblast, permanently disabling it.

links.text: -"Ukrainian Power Plant Destroyed in Russian Missile Attack: IFX". Bloomberg.com. 2024-04-11. Retrieved 2024-07-13.-

Data.event_text: 16 April  President Zelenskyy signs a new army draft law.

links.text: -"Ukraine's Zelenskiy signs new army draft law to reinforce exhausted troops". Reuters. April 16, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 April  Russia attacks Kharkiv TV Tower using a Kh-59 cruise missile, causing the portion of the tower to fall down and disrupting the broadcasting signal in Kharkiv.

links.text: -"Russian air strike took out TV tower in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Zelenskiy says". Reuters. April 22, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 April  The United States announces a $1 billion aid package for Ukraine as part of a bill that was stalled in the US Congress for months and was recently approved. The package includes ammunition for artillery and air defense systems, along with armoured fighting vehicles.

links.text: -Liptak, Michael Williams, Arlette Saenz, Kevin (2024-04-24). "Biden signs foreign aid bill providing crucial military assistance to Ukraine". CNN. Retrieved 2024-04-24.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: multiple names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: 26 April  A court orders the arrest of agriculture minister Mykola Solskyi on a charge of illegal acquisition of land worth $7 million.

links.text: -"Ukraine frees farm minister on bail pending probe into graft allegations". Reuters. April 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 May  Assassination attempts on Volodymyr Zelenskyy The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) says that it detained two Ukrainian government protection unit colonels recruited by Russia's Federal Security Service who were plotting an assassination of President Zelenskyy and other top Ukrainian officials.

links.text: -"Ukraine says it caught agents for Russia plotting Zelenskiy's murder". Reuters. May 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 May  2024 Kharkiv offensive Russia launches an offensive in Kharkiv Oblast, pushing Ukrainian forces back one kilometer from the international border.

links.text: -Sergiy Karazy; Tom Balmforth; Yuliia Dysa (11 May 2024). "Russian forces attack Ukraine's Kharkiv region, striking on new front". Yahoo! News. Reuters. Retrieved 11 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 May  Scope Ratings  the European rating agency – downgrades Ukraine’s long-term issuer rating in foreign currency from "CC" to just one level above a default rating at "C", maintaining a “Negative” Outlook. Scope is the first rating agency to cut Ukraine to this level.

links.text: -"Scope downgrades Ukraine's foreign-currency issuer rating to C and maintains a Negative Outlook". 10 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 May  Russia returns six children displaced by the war back to Ukraine, in a deal brokered by Qatar.

links.text: -"Russia returns six children to Ukraine in Qatar-brokered deal". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-05-23.-

Data.event_text: 24 May  The European Union makes a decision allowing Ukraine to use interest funds from frozen Russian bank accounts, totaling €2.5 billion ($2.7 billion) per year.

links.text: -Psaropoulos, John T. "'New ground is being broken': EU seizes Russian profits for Ukraine". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-05-25.-

Data.event_text: 27 May  Prime Minister of Spain Pedro Sánchez signs a bilateral security pact with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and pledges €1 billion (US$1.1 billion) of military aid to Ukraine.

links.text: -"Spain pledges 1 billion euros of military aid to Ukraine in 2024". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-05-27.-

Data.event_text: 29 May  Sweden announces a package of $1.23 billion in military aid to Ukraine; the largest so far given by Sweden.

links.text: -"Sweden to donate $1.23 billion in military aid to Ukraine". AP News. 2024-05-29. Retrieved 2024-05-29.-

Data.event_text: 30 May  The United States gives Ukraine permission to strike Russian territory near Kharkiv Oblast with U.S.-supplied weapons, but not with long-range missiles.

links.text: -Atwood, Alex Marquardt, Jennifer Hansler, Kylie (2024-05-30). "Biden gives Ukraine permission to carry out limited strikes within Russia using US weapons". CNN. Retrieved 2024-05-31.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: multiple names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: 7 June  The European Commission allows Ukraine to begin negotiations on joining the European Union.

links.text: -"European Commission greenlights Ukraine and Moldova for EU membership talks". TVP. June 8, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 June  The United States lifts a ban on sending U.S. weaponry to Ukraine's Azov Brigade.

links.text: -Birnbaum, Michael; O'Grady, Siobhán; Horton, Alex (2024-06-11). "U.S. lifts weapons ban on Ukrainian military unit". Washington Post. ISSN 0190-8286. Retrieved 2024-06-11.-
-Birnbaum, Michael; O'Grady, Siobhán; Horton, Alex (2024-06-11). "U.S. lifts weapons ban on Ukrainian military unit". Washington Post. ISSN 0190-8286. Retrieved 2024-06-11.-

Data.event_text: 13 June  Leaders of the G7 agree to loan Ukraine US$50 billion and use interest from Russia's frozen central bank assets as collateral for the loan.

links.text: -"G7 leaders agree to lend Ukraine billions backed by Russia's frozen assets. Here's how it will work". AP News. 2024-06-13. Retrieved 2024-06-13.-

Data.event_text: 14 June  Russian President Vladimir Putin announces that he is ready for a ceasefire if Ukraine withdraws from territories occupied by Russian forces and stops its accession to NATO. Ukraine rejects the offer.

links.text: -"Putin offers truce if Ukraine exits Russian-claimed areas and drops NATO bid. Kyiv rejects it". AP News. 2024-06-14. Retrieved 2024-06-14.-

Data.event_text: 1516 June  World leaders meet at the Bürgenstock Resort, Switzerland to advance the Ukrainian peace process.

links.text: -O'Carroll, Lisa (2024-06-15). "World leaders to gather in Swiss resort in attempt to forge Ukraine peace plan". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-06-16.-
-O'Carroll, Lisa (2024-06-15). "World leaders to gather in Swiss resort in attempt to forge Ukraine peace plan". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-06-16.-
-Niamh Kennedy; Joshua Berlinger (2024-06-16). "Major Ukraine summit ends with fresh plea for peace but key powers spurn final agreement". CNN. Retrieved 2024-06-16.-

Data.event_text: 15 June  The United States announces a $1.5 billion aid package to Ukraine, focused primarily on the country's energy industry and humanitarian assistance.

links.text: -"US unveils $1.5B in new energy, humanitarian aid for Ukraine". POLITICO. 2024-06-15. Retrieved 2024-06-15.-

Data.event_text: 16 June  Norway announces it will give Ukraine 1.1 billion kroner (US$103 million) to help repair its energy infrastructure and secure the country's electricity supply before winter.

links.text: -"Norway Gives $103mn to Ukraine to Secure Electricity". Kyiv Post. 2024-06-16. Retrieved 2024-06-16.-

Data.event_text: 20 June  Ukraine is moved to the top of the US list in receiving ordered deliveries of Patriot missile systems.

links.text: -Atwood, Kylie (2024-06-20). "Ukraine moved to top of list to receive US air defense capabilities". CNN. Retrieved 2024-06-20.-

Data.event_text: 21 June  Israel and Ukraine mutually impose travel restrictions to each others' citizens, preventing reciprocal visa-free travel without an authorization permit.

links.text: -"Israel, Ukraine to suspend visa-free regime". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-06-21. Retrieved 2024-06-22.-

Data.event_text: The European Union formally launches accession negotiations with Ukraine and Moldova.

links.text: -Baube, Olivier. "EU To Kick Off 'Historic' Membership Talks With Ukraine, Moldova". www.barrons.com. Retrieved 2024-06-25.-

Data.event_text: The European Court of Human Rights unanimously finds Russia guilty of systematic violations of human rights in Crimea.

links.text: -"Top European court finds Russia guilty of rights violations in Crimea". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-06-26.-

Data.event_text: Russia and Ukraine each return 90 prisoners of war in a prisoner exchange mediated by the United Arab Emirates.

links.text: -"Russia, Ukraine each return 90 prisoners of war". Reuters. June 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 June  President Zelenskyy signs a law establishing English as an official language of international communication in Ukraine.

links.text: -"Zelensky signs law on use of English in Ukraine". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-06-26. Retrieved 2024-06-27.-

Data.event_text: 1 July  The SBU says that it had foiled a coup plot against the Ukrainian government organised by a Russian-backed group.

links.text: -Marc Santora (1 July 2024). "Ukraine Says It Foiled Another Russian Plot to Topple the Government". The New York Times. Retrieved 2 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: Kazakh opposition activist Aydos Sadykov dies of injuries sustained after being shot in Kyiv on 18 June.

links.text: -"Kazakh dissident dies following assassination attempt in Ukraine". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán visits Kyiv for the first time since the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, proposing a ceasefire plan which is rejected by President Zelenskyy.

links.text: -"Ukraine war latest: Zelensky dismissed Orban's ceasefire proposal during his visit to Kyiv, official says". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-07-02. Retrieved 2024-07-03.-

Data.event_text: 3 July  NATO nations agree to grant Ukraine €40 billion ($43 billion) in military aid in 2025.

links.text: -"NATO members pledge 40 billion euros in military aid for Ukraine, diplomats say". Reuters. July 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 July  Fourteen people are killed and one survivor is critically injured after an oil tanker collides with a minibus near Verkhiv, Rivne Oblast.

links.text: -"Ukraine lorry collides with minibus killing 14". BBC. July 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 July  President Zelenskyy says Poland can shoot down Russian missiles inside Ukrainian airspace following the signing of a security agreement in Warsaw.

links.text: -"Zelensky on security agreement: Poland will be able to shoot down Russian missiles in skies over Ukraine". www.ukrinform.net. 2024-07-08. Retrieved 2024-07-08.-

Data.event_text: 9 July  NATO announces that it will establish a senior representative to Kyiv to coordinate with Ukrainian officials and strengthen Ukraine's ties with the bloc.

links.text: -"NATO to appoint representative in Kyiv to deepen Ukraine ties: US official". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-07-10.-

Data.event_text: 15 July  NATO establishes a new command centre in Wiesbaden, Germany to plan and coordinate support for the Ukrainian military as part of the NATO Security Assistance and Training for Ukraine.

links.text: -"NATO launches Ukraine command centre in Germany". euronews. 2024-07-15. Retrieved 2024-07-16.-

Data.event_text: Ukrainian state electrical grid operator Ukrenergo begins emergency power shutdowns in seven eastern and central oblasts amid a record heat wave and equipment failures worsened by ongoing Russian attacks.

links.text: -"Ukraine starts emergency power cuts amid record heatwave". Reuters. July 16, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Czech Republic announces plans to facilitate Colt CZ Group assault rifle production and the construction of an ammunition factory in Ukraine.

links.text: -Service, RFE/RL's Ukrainian. "Ukraine, Czech Gunmaker To Build Ammunition Factory". RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty. Retrieved 2024-07-17.-

Data.event_text: 19 July  Former Svoboda MP Iryna Farion is shot and killed by an unidentified gunman in Lviv.

links.text: -"Former Ukrainian MP Iryna Farion dies in Lviv after assassination attempt". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-07-19. Retrieved 2024-07-19.-

Data.event_text: Polish Defense Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz states that Poland will block Ukraine's bid to join the European Union if it does not resolve issues regarding the massacre of Poles by Ukrainian nationalists during World War II, including finding and burying all victims killed on current Ukrainian territory.

links.text: -"Ukraine won't enter EU without settling WWII-era Volyn massacre issue, Polish minister says". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-07-24. Retrieved 2024-07-25.-

Data.event_text: Three Ukrainian soldiers are killed and four others are injured in a mass shooting in Kharkiv Oblast.

links.text: -"Three dead in shooting incident among Ukrainian troops". al-Arabiya. July 24, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 July  Fitch Ratings downgrades Ukraine’s credit rating from "CC" to "C" due to its need to restructure US$20 billion in international bonds to foreign investors, increasing the nation's risk of default.

links.text: -"Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 881". July 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Ukraine at the 2024 Summer Olympics The Ukrainian Olympic delegation wins three gold, five silver, and four bronze medals and places 22nd out of 84 countries competing at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris.

links.text: -"Ukraine wins 3 gold, 5 silver, 4 bronze medals in Paris Olympics". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-08-11. Retrieved 2024-08-11.-

Data.event_text: 26 July  The European Union sends its first transfer of €1.5 billion (US$1.63 billion) in proceeds from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine for military and infrastructure support. The Kremlin denounces the transfer as "illegal" under international law and pledges legal retaliation.

links.text: -"EU sends first $1.6 billion from frozen Russia assets to Ukraine". AP News. 2024-07-26. Retrieved 2024-07-26.-

Data.event_text: 27 July  Hackers from the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine escalate "massive" cyberattacks on Russia's largest banks, prohibiting any cash or credit transactions. Cyberattacks also target Russian public transport systems, internet and mobile providers, and social networks.

links.text: -Dirac, Jeremy (2024-07-27). "Ukraine Hacks ATMs Across Russia in Ongoing Massive Cyberattack". Kyiv Post. Retrieved 2024-07-28.-

Data.event_text: Ukraine demands that Russia explain the death of Ukrainian POW Oleksandr Ishchenko in Russian captivity, who was being tried with 21 other captured Ukrainian troops for being part of the Azov Brigade that Russian prosecutors allege is far-right affiliated.

links.text: -"Ukraine protests against death of Azov brigade member in Russian captivity". Reuters. July 31, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico threatens to suspend Slovakia's diesel exports to Ukraine if the Ukrainian government continues to suspend pipeline oil transport from Russian oil company Lukoil, which Slovakia claims is causing a national energy crisis.

links.text: -"Slovakia's Fico threatens to cut off diesel supplies to Ukraine over Russian oil dispute". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-07-29. Retrieved 2024-08-01.-

Data.event_text: 3 August  S&P Global downgrades Ukraine's credit rating to "SD" for 'selective' default after being unable to pay a US$34 million international bond payment, while stating that Ukraine's credit rating would fall to "D" representing a complete default following restructuring of Ukraine's debt.

links.text: -"S&P cuts Ukraine rating to 'selective' default as restructuring looms". Reuters. August 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: President Zelenskyy confirms the arrival and deployment of the first batch of F-16 fighter jets pledged by Western countries in Ukraine and their usage by the Ukrainian Air Force.

links.text: -Elsa Court (4 August 2024). "Zelensky confirms F-16s already being used by Ukrainian Air Force". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 2024-08-04.-

Data.event_text: Mali breaks diplomatic relations with Ukraine following reports of the latter's involvement in an attack on Malian and Wagner Group forces by Tuareg separatists in July.

links.text: -Adam Durbin (5 August 2024). "Mali cuts diplomatic ties with Ukraine over Wagner ambush claims". BBC. Retrieved 2024-08-05.-

Data.event_text: Russia claims that Ukrainian forces have made an incursion into Kursk Oblast.

links.text: -"Moscow Rushes Troops to Kursk Region as 3 Killed in Ukrainian Attacks". The Moscow Times. 6 August 2024. Retrieved 6 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: Niger breaks diplomatic relations with Ukraine, citing claims of support for "terrorist" groups.

links.text: -"Russia accuses Ukraine of opening 'African front' as Niger cuts Kyiv ties". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-08-07.-

Data.event_text: The European Union approves a grant of €4.2 billion (US$4.58 billion) in financial aid to Ukraine.

links.text: -"EU governments give green light to 4.2 bln euros payout to Ukraine". Reuters. August 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 August  The United States announces it will send Ukraine a $125 million military aid package, including FIM-92 Stinger missiles, artillery ammunition, and anti-armor systems.

links.text: -"US to send Stinger missiles, ammunition to Ukraine in new $125 million package". Reuters. August 9, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 August  President Zelenskyy confirms ordering a major cross-border operation inside Russia's Kursk Oblast.

links.text: -Kozhukhar, Oleksandr (11 August 2024). "Zelenskiy acknowledges Ukraine's military operation in Russia". Reuters. Retrieved 11 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 August  Ukraine announces that it will create a strategic buffer zone on the RussiaUkraine border that is "designed to protect our border communities from daily enemy attacks".

links.text: -"Ukraine says advance into Russia 'going well', creates strategic buffer". Reuters. August 14, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Ukraine denies its involvement in explosions that damaged the Nord Stream 2 pipeline and accuses Russia of causing the explosions, following Germany issuing its first arrest warrant on the case towards a Ukrainian man.

links.text: -"Ukraine presidential adviser denies Ukraine's involvement in Nord Stream explosions". Reuters. August 15, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Ukraine establishes a military administration in Sudzha with major general Eduard Moskalyov appointed as its senior commander. General Oleksandr Syrskyi says that the administration will "maintain law and order" in the region.

links.text: -"Ukraine sets up military office in Russia as incursion grows". BBC News. 2024-08-15. Retrieved 2024-08-16.-

Data.event_text: Ukrainian troops and military vehicles enter Russia's Belgorod Oblast with the region declaring a state of emergency. Heavy fighting is reportedly underway.

links.text: -"Ukraine offensive in Russia expands beyond Kursk region, soldiers say". Washington Post. 2024-08-15. Retrieved 2024-08-16.-

Data.event_text: The United Kingdom says that Ukraine can use British weaponry, including Challenger 2 tanks, for its military operations inside Russia.

links.text: -"War latest: Russian state TV gloomy over Ukraine invasion of border towns - as Putin's forces capture Ukrainian territory". Sky News. Retrieved 2024-08-16.-

Data.event_text: Scope Ratings downgrades Ukraine’s long-term issuer rating in foreign currency to selective default (SD), based on the moratorium on payment of Eurobonds and an associated missed bond payment after 1 .

links.text: -"Scope downgrades Ukraine's long-term issuer rating in foreign currency to SD". 15 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: Germany issues an indefinite ban on requesting or providing new military aid to Ukraine that has not already been approved in order to reduce federal budget spending. The moratorium results in a "tangible dispute" within the Scholz coalition government.

links.text: -"Germany to halt new Ukraine military aid: Report". POLITICO. 2024-08-17. Retrieved 2024-08-18.-

Data.event_text: The International Atomic Energy Agency declares that the safety of the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant is deteriorating, following an investigation into an explosive drone strike that targeted a perimeter access road at the power plant.

links.text: -"Safety at Ukraine nuclear plant deteriorates after nearby blast, IAEA says". Reuters. August 17, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 August  Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko reports that nearly one third of the Belarusian Army has been deployed along the BelarusUkraine border, in response to Ukraine stationing more than 120,000 troops at the border. However, Ukraine claims no movement of Belarusian troops has been observed.

links.text: -"Nearly a third of Belarus army deployed on Ukraine border, Lukashenko says". Reuters. August 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Ternopil residents are urged to remain indoors after Russian drone strikes an industrial facility, causing a large fire and an increased concentration of chlorine in the air.

links.text: -"Higher chlorine air concentration in Ternopil after Russian attack on industrial site". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-08-20. Retrieved 2024-08-21.-

Data.event_text: The Verkhovna Rada passes a bill banning the activities of all Russia-associated religious groups across Ukraine, including the Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate), following arrests of dozens of the church's clerics on treason charges for alleged involvement in Russian espionage and the transfer of a cleric to Russia in a prisoner swap. The bill is signed into law by President Zelenskyy on 24 August.

links.text: -"Ukraine's parliament approves ban on Moscow-linked religious groups. One church is seen as a target". AP News. 2024-08-20. Retrieved 2024-08-21.-
-Nate Ostiller (24 August 2024). "Zelensky signs law potentially banning Moscow-linked church". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 2024-08-24.-

Data.event_text: The Verkhovna Rada votes 281-1 to ratify the Rome Statute leading to full membership in the International Criminal Court.

links.text: -"Ukraine votes to join ICC as it seeks to bring Russia to justice". Al Jazeera. 2024-08-21. Retrieved 2024-08-21.-

Data.event_text: Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger write to the United Nations Security Council to complain that Ukraine is supporting rebel groups in West Africa's Sahel region.

links.text: -"West African juntas write to UN over Ukraine's alleged rebel support". Reuters. August 21, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The United States announces a new military aid package to Ukraine, including air defense missiles, HIMARS munitions, anti-armor missiles, vehicles, and other equipment.

links.text: -"The US is sending $125 million in new military aid to Ukraine". AP News. 2024-08-22. Retrieved 2024-08-24.-

Data.event_text: During a meeting in Kyiv, Prime Minister of India Narendra Modi urges President Zelenskyy to end the Russo-Ukrainian War, and volunteers to act as a mediator in talks between Zelenskyy and Russia. In a later national address, Zelenskyy thanks Modi but states that it is necessary for India to respect international law as well as Ukraine's territorial integrity and sovereignty.

links.text: -"In Kyiv, Indian PM urges Zelenskiy to sit down for talks with Russia". Reuters. August 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: A British safety adviser working for Reuters is killed and two other journalists are injured in a Russian ballistic missile strike on their hotel in Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast.

links.text: -"Reuters safety adviser killed, two journalists injured in Ukraine's Kramatorsk". Reuters. August 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: President Zelenskyy publicly presents the Ukrainian-produced Palianytsia turbojet powered loitering munition, intended to serve as the Ukrainian counterpart to the Russian ZALA Kub-BLA.

links.text: -"Зеленський опублікував деталі про українську ракету-дрон "Паляниця"". Українська правда (in Ukrainian). Retrieved 2024-08-26.-

Data.event_text: Pope Francis condemns the Ukrainian government's ban of the Moscow-linked Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate) and other Russia-linked religious groups as infringing on Ukrainians' civil right to religious freedom.

links.text: -"Pope Francis criticizes push to ban activities of Russian-affiliated religious organizations in Ukraine". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-08-25. Retrieved 2024-08-26.-

Data.event_text: Audits conducted by the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense determine that between March and July, multiple Armed Forces of Ukraine units never received nearly US$4.2 million in military aid labeled as "humanitarian aid" to bypass customs fees, prompting embezzlement and illicit enrichment investigations.

links.text: -"Audit discovers over $4 million in imported 'humanitarian aid' never reached destination". The Kyiv Independent. 2024-08-26. Retrieved 2024-08-27.-

Data.event_text: An F-16 fighter jet belonging to the Ukrainian Air Force crashes in action during a Russian air attack, killing its pilot.

links.text: -Kottasová, Daria Tarasova-Markina, Ivana (2024-08-29). "Exclusive: Top Ukrainian pilot killed when US-made F-16 fighter jet crashed". CNN. Retrieved 2024-08-29.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: multiple names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: President Zelenskyy announces that Ukraine has successfully tested a domestically-produced ballistic missile for the first time.

links.text: -"Україна створила першу балістичну ракету – Зеленський". Українська правда (in Ukrainian). Retrieved 2024-08-27.-

Data.event_text: President Zelenskyy announces that Poland will cooperate with Ukraine to return Ukrainians "who violated the law, traitors, collaborators" by illegally crossing the PolandUkraine border in order to escape conscription in the Russo-Ukrainian War.

links.text: -"Ukraine has agreements with Poland on the return of Ukrainians who illegally crossed the border - Zelenskyy". unn.ua. 2024-08-27. Retrieved 2024-08-27.-

Data.event_text: President Zelenskyy dismisses Mykola Oleshchuk as the commander of the Ukrainian Air Force following the fatal crash of an F-16 fighter jet on 26 August and replaces him with Anatolii Kryvonozhko,

links.text: -"President Zelensky sacks Ukraine air force commander Mykola Oleshchuk". BBC. 31 August 2024. Retrieved 2024-08-31.-

Data.event_text: President Zelenskyy urges Mongolia to arrest Russian President Vladimir Putin as he travels to Ulaanbaatar to make his first meeting to an International Criminal Court member state since the issue of his ICC arrest warrant.

links.text: -"Ukraine urges Mongolia to arrest Putin on ICC warrant during upcoming visit". France 24. 2024-08-30. Retrieved 2024-08-31.-

Data.event_text: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg declares that Ukraine's incursion into Russian territory in Kursk Oblast is legitimate under Ukraine's right to self-defense.

links.text: -"Ukraine's incursion into Russia's Kursk region is legitimate, says NATO's Stoltenberg". Reuters. August 30, 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least 58 people are killed and 328 others are injured in a Russian missile attack in Poltava.

links.text: -Hodunova, Kateryna (8 September 2024). "3 people injured in Russian Sept. 3 strike on Poltava die in hospital". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 8 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: Five ministers resign from their positions, including Deputy Prime Minister Olha Stefanishyna and foreign minister Dmytro Kuleba, resulting in a vacancy in more than a third of the cabinet.

links.text: -"Ukraine arms chief, four ministers resign in government shake-up". Reuters. September 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 September  Ukraine begins the implementation of "dragon drones" that spray molten thermite on forest cover to reveal and help destroy Russian military units and equipment.

links.text: -"What are 'dragon drones', Ukraine's latest weapon against Russia?". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-09-10.-

Data.event_text: 10 September  The Netherlands lifts all its weapon restrictions on military equipment it granted to Ukraine, allowing its army to target Russia with deep strikes while urging other nations to lift their weapon restrictions as well.

links.text: -"Netherlands Greenlights Kyiv to Hit Russia, Calls for All to Lift Weapon Restrictions". Kyiv Post. 2024-09-10. Retrieved 2024-09-10.-

Data.event_text: 12 September  President Zelenskyy denounces a BrazilianChinese peace initiative, stating that both nations are effectively siding with Russia for allowing the Russian army to take Ukrainian territory as a means to "de-escalate" the war instead of assisting Ukraine in resisting the invasion.

links.text: -"'You either support war or you don't' — Zelensky blasts China-Brazil 'destructive' peace initiative". September 12, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 September  The U.S. Central Intelligence Agency reports that due to the ongoing war, Ukraine's death rate is now the highest in the world at 18.6 per thousand people, while its birth rate is the lowest at six children born per thousand people.

links.text: -Post, Kyiv (2024-09-13). "Ukraine Faces World's Lowest Birth Rate and Highest Death Rate, CIA Report Says". Kyiv Post. Retrieved 2024-09-14.-

Data.event_text: 14 September  Following a meeting in Kyiv, the foreign ministers of Poland and Ukraine call for ending social benefits for Ukrainian men in Poland, and for programs in the European Union to return them to Ukraine in order to stop draft evasion.

links.text: -"Polish minister, visiting Kyiv, calls for end to benefits for Ukrainian men in Europe". Reuters. September 15, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Ukrainian Foreign Ministry invites the United Nations and the International Committee of the Red Cross to join humanitarian efforts in Russia's Kursk Oblast.

links.text: -"Ukraine invites UN and ICRC to Russia's Kursk region". Reuters. September 16, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Ukrainian officials publicly distance themselves from the suspect in the Trump International Golf Club shooting carried out against Donald Trump and warn that Russia will use the situation for anti-Ukrainian propaganda, following reports of the suspect protesting for the Azov Brigade and regularly calling for international support and troops for Ukraine.

links.text: -"Ryan Routh, reported suspect in Trump assassination attempt, backed Ukraine". Reuters. September 16, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 September  President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen announces a loan of up to €35 billion (US$39 billion) for Ukraine in military and energy support following President Zelenskyy's drafting of a new victory plan against Russia.

links.text: -"EU's von der Leyen announces 35 bln euro loan in Kyiv visit". Reuters. September 22, 2024.-

Data.event_text: President Zelenskyy accuses Brazil and China of using their proposed peace plan for ending the RussoUkrainian War to boost their geopolitical power "at Ukraine's expense" by urging developing nations to agree to it.

links.text: -"Zelenskiy takes aim at China, Brazil push for peace in Ukraine". Reuters. September 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Republican Speaker of the House Mike Johnson demands that President Zelenskyy dismiss Ukrainian ambassador to the United States Oksana Markarova after Zelenskyy visited an ammunition factory in Pennsylvania with several Democratic politicians, which Johnson claims represented foreign electoral intervention.

links.text: -"Top Republican wants Ukrainian ambassador to US fired, ahead of Zelenskiy visit". Reuters. September 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 September  US President Joe Biden announces a military aid package of over US$8 billion for Ukraine and directs the Department of Defense to allocate all remaining security funds to Ukraine by his term's end in January 2025, prior to a meeting with President Zelenskyy in the White House.

links.text: -"Biden announces $8 billion in military aid for Ukraine". Reuters. September 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 September  Leonid Loboyko, a judge of the Supreme Court of Ukraine, is killed by a Russian drone strike in Kozacha Lopan, Kharkiv Oblast while delivering humanitarian aid to the area.

links.text: -Abbey Fenbert (28 September 2024). "Ukrainian Supreme Court judge killed in Russian drone attack". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 28 September 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 October  President Zelenskyy accuses North Korea of sending soldiers to participate in the Russian invasion.

links.text: -"Zelenskyy accuses North Korea of sending soldiers to help Russia in war". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-10-24.-

Data.event_text: 22 October  Prosecutor General Andriy Kostin resigns after a number of scandals involving medical exemptions for men of military age to avoid being conscripted into the Ukrainian military.

links.text: -"Ukrainian prosecutor general resigns amid scandal over draft exemptions". Al Jazeera. 2024-10-22. Retrieved 2024-10-23.-

Data.event_text: 4 November  Ukraine announces its first combat engagements with North Korean soldiers in Russia's Kursk Oblast.

links.text: -Martin Fornusek (4 November 2024). "First North Korean troops come under fire in Kursk Oblast, Ukrainian official claims". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 2024-11-04.-

Data.event_text: 8 November  Ukraine terminates its air service agreement with Iran that had been in place since 1993 amid the latter's support for the Russian invasion.

links.text: -Kateryna Denisova (8 November 2024). "Ukraine breaks air service agreement with Iran". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 2024-11-09.-

Data.event_text: 13 November  The European General Court rules against a petition by the State Border Guard Service of Ukraine to trademark the phrase "Russian warship, go fuck yourself" first used during the Snake Island campaign in 2022, citing its being a "political slogan".

links.text: -"Ukraine Cannot Trademark Phrase 'Russian Warship, Go F*** Yourself,' EU Court Says". The Moscow Times. 13 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-13.-
